snippet: The hedge fund, which is majority owned by Carlyle Group, is talking to investors to assess what to do next.
abstract: Investors are seeking to withdraw around $2 billion from Claren Road Asset Management, hedge fund that is majority owned by Carlyle Group, leaving firm with just $2.1 billion of investor money left.
lead_paragraph: The hedge fund, which is majority owned by Carlyle Group, is talking to investors to assess what to do next.

headline.main: Claren Road Investors Seek to Pull Out Nearly $2 Billion
headline.print_headline: Investors Ask for $2 Billion From a Fund Carlyle Owns
